Description: The temptation of St Antony; a scene in a cave with the saint kneeling and holding a small volume with a diabolical figure at his shoulder and gesturing; various grotesque creatures crowd the space; at left, a cooking pot heating over a fire; second state with retouchings and altered inscription; after David Teniers the Younger Etching and drypoint
Producer name: Print made by: Frans van den Wyngaerde
Curator's comments: For an impression of first state of this plate see also S.5611. A related drawing is in Musée des Beaux Arts, Rennes.
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (8.II)
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
